args:
The Halidom's fall deals a heavy blow to morale
among the siblings, but they regroup, formulate
a plan, and begin the fight to reclaim it. The
strategy succeeds until Alberius uses their own
plan against them, placing them in checkmate.
(The mood in here is suffocating... I'd kill\nto be anywhere else...)
Valyx! Oh, thank goodness you're awake. I\nwas worried when you lost consciousness\nmid-retreat.
This is the wooded city of Rovetelle, south\nof the Halidom. They were kind enough to\nlend us the use of a room.
Zethia, {player_name}, any of\nyou... What is the situation?
After we withdrew, we received word that\nthe Halidom has fallen to the enemy.
Alberius and the black mana fiends have\ntaken it for their own stronghold and\nremain there now.
That was the cradle and crux of all our\nefforts... Seeing it stolen away so easily\nhas dealt a massive blow to morale.
It was a stark defeat... Small wonder the\nprevailing mood is a mix of grief over the\nHalidom and despair at our war prospects.
...I will reclaim the Halidom, whatever it\ntakes. It's the cornerstone of any hopes of\nvictory in this fight.
That place is more than just a stronghold.\nIt is the seat of hope and peace of mind for\nall of us. We must have it back!
That's all well and good to say, but HOW\ndo you plan to take it? I trust you're not\njust spouting promises without a plan?
I...may not have a concrete plan just yet,\nbut I still need to make it clear to everyone\nthat I've not given up.
Oh, please. Just don't expect me to charge\nheadlong to my death beside you. There's\nno point in fighting unless you can win.
Not true, Emile. Even if our odds are grim,\nwe still must fight.
A citizenry stripped of hope soon becomes\ndesperate, and the kingdom will fall from\nwithin. We must show them all is not lost.
Such is our duty as royalty, to protect the\npeople. All the more so if the threat comes\nfrom one who shares our blood.
Urgh. I suppose that's... That's fair, but...
Oh? I feel the point Emile raises is\nextremely reasonable.
Embarking on a lost fight lacks elegance.
I've little concern for elegance, but Emile\nis correct to state that fighting a losing war\nis meaningless.
So you and Chelle think we ought not fight\nagainst that Alberius?
Do not mistake me. I'm merely saying not\nto fight with the intention of losing.
So if we're to fight, do it under the\nassumption of victory?
Obviously. We win, or the future is lost.\nFailure is unacceptable.
Or had you all intended to lose again?
Hmph. Then let's begin formulating our\nplan to grind that smug ersatz hero into\nthe dirt beneath our boots.
So you were here. Emile was worried.\nYou've only just recovered.
I'm in sorry shape indeed if I've a brother\nlike him worrying for me.
We draw the enemy's attention while\n{player_name} strikes Alberius.\nA poetic bit of revenge for the Halidom.
We've crafted contingencies for everything\nfrom terrain to weather conditions down to\nthe last detail. ...I have no doubts.
Perhaps you wanted to be the one to face\nAlberius?
I acknowledge our brother's skill... He has\nthe blood, the strength, and the faith of\nthe people. He's a true royal.
Ahh yes, the three qualifications for a king,\nwas it? I recall you speaking of them when\nwe were children.
I was bedridden with wyrmscale back then.\nYou and the others were my only link to\nworld beyond my chamber door.
Days of cursing my fate, of fearing death's\ncoming... But still I burned with a hunger\nfor my research, to chase that faint hope.
I've kept company with unrequited hunger\ntoo long not to notice, brother. ...You're\nbiting your tongue about something.
...Perhaps you're right. But this is not the\ntime for selfishness.
{player_name} was assigned the\ntask of fighting Alberius will my blessing,\nand yours, and all the others'.
Yes, but what are your true feelings? You\nhave long silenced your own voice to be an\ninstrument in achieving others' designs.
Might it not be time to turn your eye from\nthe outward ideal you seek to uphold and\nlook inward? What is it you hunger for?
...I do wish to face the hero I admire and\nseek to emulate. To fight an honorable\nduel, one warrior against another.
...But what about you? Do you still think\nyourself the cause of all this?
I expect your desire to stop Alberius is\neven greater than mine. Am I mistaken?
Whatever you might say to me now, I have\nno intention of objecting to the plan. This\nis the correct choice, as the royal line.
Valyx... I only hope you're certain.
The next day, north of the Halidom\nOperating base of Leonidas's army\nCommand Center
Final preparations are complete, my liege.\nAwaiting orders, sir.
Good... Then the operation to retake the\nHalidom shall commence! Send up the\nstarting flare!
West of the Halidom\nOperating base of Chelle's army
That's the flare. Look alive, people, it's\nladies first! Ohh ho ho!
South of the Halidom\nOperating base of Valyx's army
They've sent up the signal. Everything here\nis ready to go... Move out, men!
East of the Halidom\nOperating base of Emile's army
The first flare has been fired. The plan is\nfor us to move after the second. ...Right?\nPhares?
That's correct. Chelle and Valyx should be\ncommencing their attack now.
Once the enemy mobilizes to meet them,\nthey'll begin falling back, drawing the\nenemy to the Halidom's south and west.
Then, once their defenses are stretched\nthin, Leonidas and we strike from the east\nand north. ...But will this really work?
Obviously we can't expect that everything\nwill go exactly to plan, but—
Oh. There's the second flare. It would seem\nthings are going to plan so far, at least.
R-right. In that case... Time to move out,\nyou lot! All of you, fall in behind me!
A simultaneous strike from all directions...\nAlberius will surely realize this is a feint.
But for that very reason, he should be\nreluctant to make a move before he knows\nwhere the real attack is coming from.
Next is {player_name}'s unit,\nbut... I'm a bit concerned.
Emile is leading the troops well. I shall\nhead out on an independent raid.
It seems the fighting has begun.
Yes. If things are going to plan, his forces\nshould have been drawn out of the\nHalidom by now.
A friend of mine dug these tunnels as a\nmeans of escape in emergencies. ...I never\nthought I'd be using them as a way IN.
Their numbers inside the castle should be\nthin, but Alberius should still be here\ntracking the status of the four fronts...
We'll take him out, here and now!
Alberius isn't here. There's no sign of any\nblack mana or fiends or dragons, either.
However successful our sibling's diversion,\nthere's no way that not a single enemy\nwould be left in—
Thank you, {player_name}. A\nsurprise attack? This is—
We're surrounded?! But how did they react\nthis quickly?
An ambush... They read our strategy! Then\nAlberius is—
Did you think to find me just sitting about\nthe castle?
Awfully impatient for a storied hero, aren't\nyou? I didn't think you would take such\nobvious bait.
Sorry, but waiting around was never my\nstyle.
In that case, we shall gladly take the\nHalidom back from you. I'd have thought a\nhero would be a bit smarter?
Hah. If you hope to provoke me and buy\ntime, I'll disappoint you. I can handle you\nlot and make it back with time to spare.
...You flatter yourself. But I know you're\nnot just idle talk!
B-bad news, sir! Lady Chelle and Leonidas\nare routed! Their forces are retreating!
What?! Both of them are already...
And the Dyrenell Army under Emperor\nEmile is all but wiped out! At this rate, our\nown forces will soon fall!
Black mana-frenzied fiends and dragons\nare formidable, but it shouldn't be possible\nfor them to change the tides so quickly.
Draw my forces out in each direction, then\nstrike me at the Halidom, was that it? I'm\nafraid your little plan missed the mark.
I expect you've already heard, but I've\ncrushed the other three. It's just you now.\n...What's your move?
I stand indomitable... I will avenge the\nhumiliation you dealt me! STAND READY,\nSIR!
